DESC.PARA: A thermal bremsstrahlung spectrum based on the Kellogg, Baldwin and Koch (ApJ 199, 299) polynomial fits to the Karzas and Latter numerical values. A routine from Kurucz is used for low temperatures. The He abundance is assumed to be 8.5% of H by number.
This is an additive model component.

ROW.DATA: (3.02e-15/4/pi/D^2) Int n_e n_I dV , where n_e is the electron density (cm^-3), n_I is the ion density (cm^-3), and D is the distance to the source (cm).

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.7 of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.4.
